sense.def: archaic, metaphysical: Heaven (YI)

tls:text.tls:line: and Kun is activated/activates itself to form things. [1136]

sense.def: (abstract, cosmological:) earth (YI)

tls:text.tls:line: therefore it is referred to as a "mother"

sense.def: be referred to as (not really "called")
be referred to as (not really "called")
cause N to be clothed by V-ing

gramGrp.tls:sem-feat: action as performed by the means N

sense.def: Nab2 as performed by means of Nab1

tls:text.tls:line: the principles of All under Heaven are (got>) put in place.

sense.def: 天下之物 the sublunar world; all there is under Heaven; the sublunar world

tls:text.tls:line: As the principles of All under Heaven are put in place [1139]

seg.line: 古者包犧氏之王天下也

tls:text.tls:srcline: 古者包犧氏之王天下也

sense.def: 天下之華夏 all the (civilised, i.e. Han-dominated or Han-accessible) world; the whole (civilised political) world； the Chinese political scene

tls:text.tls:srcline: 古者包犧氏之王天下也

sense.def: 普天之下 all under the sun; the whole world; the sublunar social world (including the regions beyond Chinese domination) cf. oikoumenē,
＝天下人 generalising: everyone in the world; mankind; all the world> everyone everywhere；German: alle Welt
＝天下之國（all） the polities in the Han-dominated world
preside over the government of; attend to (matters of government), conduct (government); supervise
天下之物 the sublunar world; all there is under Heaven; the sublunar world
the world as a space (for all things including humans); by implication: everyone in this space
fill (primarily a container or a depression in the earth)
be N; be N (and none/nothing else)
Heaven and Earth as cosmological constituents of the universe; the cosmic force of the universe

seg.line: 觀其所感而天地萬物之情可見矣

tls:text.tls:srcline: 觀其所感而天地萬物之情可見矣

sense.def: all manner of things between heaven and earth, including all kinds of animals, plants and things

seg.line: 觀其所恆而天地萬物之情可見矣

tls:text.tls:srcline: 觀其所恆而天地萬物之情可見矣

sense.def: all manner of things between heaven and earth, including all kinds of animals, plants and things

tls:text.tls:srcline: 觀其所恆而天地萬物之情可見矣

form.pron: tiān dì wàn wù zhī qíng

sense.def: the essential truth about everything
Heaven-determined inevitable course of events in this world; the invariable way of things evolving in this world; the natural course of events
multiply by two; double up; make twice as many
essence as a book (compare 為物 "essence as a person")
High Heaven, 老天: =昊天
as the times require; as appropriate to the (changing) occasions
reflect upon one's own person; try to assess one's own person; German: in sich gehen
